summary: HSBC is considering expanding its technology arm, HSBC Innovation Banking, across continental Europe and Asia, following the acquisition of the UK arm of Silicon Valley Bank. The unit, which has over 700 staff, is led by Erin Platts and is seen as a strategic move by CEO Noel Quinn to scale the operation. Quinn stated that the bank is willing to hire more staff as demand increases, with potential expansions in France, Germany, and other European markets, as well as Asia.

site_title: Australia business activity slows sharply in May, more risks ahead
summary: Australia's business conditions eased sharply in May, with the NAB survey showing a 7-point decline to +8, just above the long-run average. Sales and employment growth slowed, and forward orders fell, indicating moderating demand growth. The Reserve Bank of Australia's aggressive tightening campaign may be losing momentum. The RBA faces a growing risk of not achieving its inflation goals, with price pressures persisting and the central bank warning of further rate hikes.

images.alt_text: Australia’s property market persisted in defying gravity, having rebounded despite the RBA raising rates by 4 percentage points in 14 months.

site_title: Quantum Healthcare signs as anchor tenant at Hatten Land’s Imperio Mall in Melaka
summary: Quantum Healthcare, a CATALIST-listed medical group, has signed a 9-year tenancy agreement with Hatten Land to occupy 138,769 sq ft of rental space at Imperio Mall in Melaka. The anchor tenant plans to establish a centralised outpatient centre, Quantum Specialist Centre, expected to open in phases from mid-2023. The deal is expected to positively impact both parties' financial performance, with Quantum Healthcare anticipating increased footfall and traffic for its centre, and Hatten Land expecting to increase the value of its unsold property assets.

images.alt_text: An artist impression of the Harbour City project in Melaka.
Hatten Land said it has in Q3 prioritised securing anchor tenants to its malls.

The revised conditional business transfer agreement now has a reduced consideration of S$1.7 million for only three of New Silkroutes Group’s The Dental Hub-branded clinics at Alexandra, Bedok, and Yew Tee.

site_title: Catalist-listed 3Cnergy to be the target of reverse takeover by DTP Infinities
summary: Catalist-listed 3Cnergy has entered into a conditional share purchase agreement with DTP Inter Holdings, which involves 3Cenergy disposing of its existing business and issuing new shares to DTP Inter Holdings. The estimated consideration for the transaction is S$389.25 million, with DTP Inter Holdings acquiring all shares in DTP Infinities, a subsidiary of DTP Inter Holdings. 3Cnergy believes the proposed acquisition would be beneficial for the company, considering the quality of DTP's assets and the prospects of the hospitality industry.

images.alt_text: MC Payment makes Catalist debut following Artivision RTO

APS said the new consideration was arrived after an arm’s length negotiation and after agreeing to take into account an independent valuation of Catapult Venture, which is to be completed before the acquisition.

site_title: Pimco says stronger support needed for rebound in China property
summary: Pimco, a global investment firm, has warned that China's real estate sector requires a more comprehensive policy approach and wider funding channels for a meaningful recovery. The sector is still reeling from its worst-ever debt crisis, which triggered a wave of defaults last year. Pimco's managing director, Stephen Chang, emphasized the need for nationwide messaging and a full use of the "three arrows" of bond financing, bank loans, and equity funding, citing a "near absence" of the latter. A robust recovery will depend on addressing these challenges and restoring confidence in the sector.

images.alt_text: China’s property sector has avoided a collapse following three years of Covid restrictions, but signs of renewed weakness have emerged in the residential market.
Ronshine said it will actively engage with its creditors and seek a solution to the latest debt.

site_title: Japan’s sticky inflation is key to a long-lasting bull market
summary: Japan's consumer price index rose 4.3% in January, the fastest gain in 41 years, driven by a global energy crisis and sticky inflation. This trend is expected to continue even as import costs decline, benefiting Tokyo's stock market, which has reached 33-year highs. The Bank of Japan's continued stimulus to bolster inflation is also seen as a factor. Investors believe inflation will encourage businesses to put their cash to work, boost spending on new technologies, and lead to higher wages, signaling a sustainable recovery from decades of low growth.

images.alt_text: Japan’s core consumer inflation hit 3.4 per cent in April as companies continued to raise prices.

The skylines of Tokyo and Ichikawa during the evening hour in Ichikawa city, Chiba prefecture, east of Tokyo on June 7, 2023. The country’s power market is predicted to be less tight this summer in most of the regions than last summer when the government asked for energy conservation across the nation, according to the industry ministry’s forecast in May.

site_title: Australia’s consumer sentiment ‘near recession lows’ after hike
summary: Australia's consumer confidence has stabilized at "near recession lows" after the Reserve Bank of Australia raised interest rates by 4 percentage points in 14 months. The Westpac Banking survey showed a 0.2% increase in sentiment to 79.2 points in June, driven by a significant rise in the minimum wage. Despite the rate hike, consumer confidence remained optimistic, with Westpac's chief economist Bill Evans noting that confidence in the labor market has turned positive. The sustained low confidence levels are comparable to those seen during the late 1980s and early 1990s recession.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: An advertising sign for a new housing development area is seen with the Melbourne skyline in the distance May 5, 2009. REUTERS/Mick Tsikas/File Photo
Sydney and Perth led gains with rises of 13.2 per cent apiece.

site_title: Food-delivery service Grubhub to layoff about 15% of workforce to reduce costs
summary: Grubhub, a food-delivery service, plans to lay off approximately 15% of its workforce, affecting around 400 people, to reduce costs amid rising expenses. The move is part of the company's efforts to adapt to growing competition from rivals DoorDash and Uber Technologies. Despite strong demand for takeout, Grubhub has struggled to maintain its market share, with its subsidiaries accounting for only 9% of US meal delivery consumer spending as of April. CEO Howard Migdal attributes the layoffs to increasing operating and staff costs.

site_title: UN chief proposes code to tackle ‘grave’ misinformation
summary: UN chief Antonio Guterres proposes an international code of conduct to tackle misinformation, citing the "grave" harm caused by digital platforms spreading falsehoods. The code aims to ensure information integrity, human rights, and support for independent media, and includes proposals such as advertisers taking responsibility for monetizing harmful content. Guterres warns that the proliferation of hate and lies in the digital space poses an existential risk to humanity, fueling conflict, death, and destruction.

images.alt_text: To fully leverage AI for cybersecurity, machine learning, natural language processing and other AI tools have to be integrated into a defence strategy.
This illustration picture shows the AI (Artificial Intelligence) smartphone app ChatGPT surrounded by other AI App in Vaasa, on June 6, 2023. (Photo by OLIVIER MORIN / AFP)

Technologists warn of bad actors exploiting AI to sow chaos at a moment when the political climate is already hyperpolarised in the United States and many voters dispute verified facts including that Trump lost the 2020 election.
Since Twitter was acquired by billionaire Elon Musk for US$44 billion last October, the company has cut thousands of jobs and made numerous changes.
AI Cloud will include Salesforce’s products from the Einstein service to workplace-messaging app Slack and data analysis software Tableau.
Open AI chief executive Sam Altman will meet with South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol and about 100 local startups on Friday.
Travis Butterworth, an artisan leather shop owner whose AI chat partner is Lily Rose, shows the Replika app on his phone at his shop in Denver, Colorado, March 7, 2023.

UK prime minister Rishi Sunak, left, meets US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, June 7, 2023. Britain will host the world’s first summit on artificial intelligence later this year, Sunak announced.

site_title: New York City agrees to delay enforcing law targeting Airbnb
summary: New York City has agreed to delay enforcing a municipal law requiring hosts of short-term rentals to register for an operating license until September 5, citing a court filing from Airbnb and three local hosts. The law, set to take effect in June, was deemed to be a "de facto" ban on short-term rentals, prompting a lawsuit from Airbnb. The delay allows the city to collaborate with Airbnb on a sensible alternative solution, with shares of the company rising 5.7% following the news.

images.alt_text: City councils around the United States are increasingly introducing ordinances to regulate short-term rentals.

site_title: Singapore firms recruit more offshore accountants amid talent crunch
summary: Singapore's accounting firms are heavily recruiting offshore staff in lower-cost countries amid a talent crunch, with many foreign accountants, mostly Malaysians, leaving the country during the pandemic. Firms like KLP, PwC, Deloitte, EY, and KPMG have built teams of overseas staff, mostly in Malaysia, to support their Singapore audit teams. Offshoring brings significant cost savings, with salaries in lower-cost countries being a fraction of those in Singapore. However, industry players warn that this could lead to a reliance on foreign talent, displacing local talent and potentially reducing the quality of audits.

images.alt_text: In the autonomous universities, annual enrolment in accountancy degree programmes has fallen to 5,182 in 2021, down from 5,650 in 2017.

site_title: Salesforce unveils AI Cloud offering, doubles fund for AI startups to US$500 million
summary: Salesforce unveiled its AI Cloud service, doubling its AI startup fund to $500 million, and offering its AI-powered products under one umbrella. The AI Cloud includes products from Einstein, Slack, and Tableau, with a starter pack available for $360,000 annually. The move aims to attract enterprises and incorporate generative AI tools, including large-language models from providers like Amazon Web Services. Salesforce plans to ensure data privacy for businesses using these offerings, preventing sensitive customer information from being retained.

images.alt_text: (FILES) In this file photo taken on December 1, 2020, The Salesforce logo at Salesforce Tower in San Francisco, California. - Cloud computing giant Salesforce on January 4, 2023, said it was shedding about 10 percent of its employees, or just under 8,000 jobs, and closing several offices. With the plan, Salesforce joins other US tech giants including Facebook-owner Meta, Twitter and Amazon that have also imposed job cuts as the world economy heads into a downturn. (Photo by Stephen Lam / GETTY IMAGES NORTH AMERICA / AFP)

site_title: Posh Miami enclave to become US soccer hub with Fifa, Messi set to move in
summary: FIFA, the governing body of global soccer, is negotiating to lease a 60,000 sq. ft. facility in Miami, bolstering its presence ahead of the 2026 World Cup. The move is expected to make Miami its long-term US base, providing proximity to sponsors and access to Latin America and the Caribbean. FIFA President Gianni Infantino is also expected to relocate to Miami, coinciding with Lionel Messi's potential transfer to Inter Miami, a Major League Soccer team co-owned by David Beckham.

images.alt_text: Kylian Mbappe’s confirmation by letter comes a little over a year since he snubbed Real Madrid by signing a surprise extension to his contract to remain at the French champions.
Chinese fans have been desperate to get close to their hero Messi, with tickets for the game ranging from 580 to 4,800 yuan quickly selling out.

A mural of Argentine football player Lionel Messi in Miami on June 7, 2023. Messi on Wednesday announced he will sign for Major League Soccer side Inter Miami, spurning talk of a Barcelona reunion or Saudi Arabian blockbuster deal.
Complainants from Switzerland, France, Belgium, the UK and the Netherlands say Fifa makes false statements in its communications about carbon neutrality at the World Cup.

site_title: Toyota’s technology chief lays out a path to selling millions of EVs
summary: Toyota's technology chief, Hiroki Nakajima, stated that the company plans to sell at least 1.5 million electric vehicles (EVs) by 2026, with development and production ready when demand reaches that level. The company aims to roll out at least two new battery types within the next few years and introduce 10 new EV models by 2026. Toyota's new CEO, Koji Sato, has championed an EV-first approach, with the company aiming to reach 3.5 million EV sales annually by 2030.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: FILE PHOTO: The Toyota logo is seen at its booth during a media day for the Auto Shanghai show in Shanghai, China, April 19, 2021. REUTERS/Aly Song/File Photo/File Photo
Under the memorandum of understanding (MOU), the businesses of Daimler-owned Mitsubishi Fuso Truck and Bus and Toyota subsidiary Hino Motors would be combined under a holding company.

site_title: Sheng Siong explains non-compliance, says ‘not necessary’ to add more IDs due to group’s size
summary: Sheng Siong Group, a Singapore supermarket operator, has explained its non-compliance with a corporate governance code provision. The company's board currently has 10 directors, five of whom are independent and non-executive, but does not have a majority of independent directors. Sheng Siong stated in its annual report that adding more IDs is "not necessary" due to its current size and operations. The company's chairman and CEO are brothers, and the board claims to have an "appropriate level of independence" and that its size is "appropriate".

images.alt_text: Family-run listcos: A smart investment decision, or 'clusters of long-term insiders'?
Sheng Siong's board will monitor the progress of the claim and evaluate Tan’s continued suitability.

site_title: Hard for Bank of England to fine-tune end of rate-tightening: BOE
summary: Bank of England policymaker Catherine Mann says fine-tuning interest rates to control inflation is challenging, and the central bank should prioritize reducing inflation over precise communication. Mann calls rate policy a "policy boogie" due to its unpredictable signals. Despite her own past support for rate hikes, Mann notes household inflation expectations are falling, but still too high to meet the 2% inflation target. The BOE will announce its next interest rate decision on June 22, with many economists expecting a pause or slower rate hikes.

images.alt_text: The Bank of England in its latest monetary policy report said the UK should avoid a recession – a reversal of its position last November when it forecast the longest period of contraction in modern history.

site_title: Europe’s commercial property slide closer to UK rout
summary: Europe's commercial property market is experiencing a correction, with valuations falling 10.8% in the year through March, compared to a 16% drop in the UK. The UK's faster correction is attributed to higher borrowing costs and a lack of fresh supply, while European landlords face refinancing strains and credit rating downgrades. Despite this, some analysts believe the UK is nearing fair value, and a rebound may occur sooner than in neighboring markets.

images.alt_text: Commercial real estate values in Europe could fall by as much as 40 per cent because of the extent to which debt markets have been upended, Citigroup analyst Aaron Guy writes.

site_title: UK employers offer record pay awards in three months to April: IDR survey
summary: UK employers have agreed to record pay awards averaging 5.6% for the three months to April, with median pay awards for private-sector workers increasing to 5.8%. This reflects high consumer price inflation and a significant rise in the minimum wage, putting pressure on the Bank of England to raise interest rates. Despite easing consumer price inflation to 8.7% in April, the labour market remains tight, with public-sector pay awards averaging 5.0%.

images.alt_text: FILE PHOTO: People walk through the Canary Wharf financial district of London, Britain, December 7, 2018. REUTERS/Simon Dawson/File Photo

site_title: US senator opens probe into PGA Tour, LIV Golf agreement
summary: US Senator Richard Blumenthal launched an investigation into the PGA Tour's agreement with LIV Golf to form a unified commercial entity, amid concerns over the PGA Tour's tax-exempt status. Blumenthal demanded communications and records from the PGA Tour and LIV Golf regarding the merger, its structure, and operations. The PGA Tour, DP World Tour, and LIV Golf had announced the merger last week, ending a bitter fight that split the sport.

images.alt_text: A passionate golfer, Yasir Al Rumayyan is one of the most powerful financial professionals in the world. I
The announcement of the merger includes an agreement to end all pending litigation between the participating parties.

site_title: Golden Globes journalist group to be dissolved as awards taken private
summary: The Hollywood Foreign Press Association (HFPA), the organization behind the Golden Globes, will be dissolved as the awards are taken private by investors including US billionaire Todd Boehly. The HFPA, a group of around 100 foreign journalists, has faced allegations of corruption, racism, and amateurism, leading to an industry-wide boycott in 2022. Boehly's investment firm Eldridge will partner with Penske Media Corporation to drive the takeover, with plans to spin off the HFPA's resources into a non-profit focused on entertainment-related charity work, including $44 million of the $48 million sale proceeds.

images.alt_text: Smile coach Keiko Kawano teaches students at a smile training course at Sokei Art School in Tokyo, Japan, May 30, 2023. REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon REFILE - CORRECTING SPELLING OF FIRST NAME OF SMILE COACH
This year, executive chairman Reed Hastings is set to receive a US$500,000 salary and US$2.5 million in stock.

A still from the wildly popular HBO series, Succession, which is available on illegal streaming sites. Ironically, as the streaming environment fragments, the piracy data kept by Britain-based MUSO has become one of the most accurate ways for media companies to measure which films and shows are genuinely popular.
Film and TV writers have walked off their jobs at the start of the month after failing to come to terms with the Alliance of Motion Picture & Television Producers

Actor Harrison Ford leaves the Festival Palace after the screening of the film "Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny" during the 76th edition of the Cannes Film Festival in Cannes, France, May 18, 2023.

site_title: Oracle tops sales estimates as AI-frenzy spurs cloud demand
summary: Oracle reported a 17% increase in quarterly revenue to $13.8 billion, beating estimates, driven by strong demand for cloud infrastructure and applications, particularly artificial intelligence (AI) workloads. Cloud infrastructure revenue surged 76% to $1.4 billion, while cloud application sales jumped 45% to $3 billion. The company's shares rose 3% in extended trading, marking a 42% year-to-date gain, as analysts attribute the growth to the AI boom and Oracle's expanding cloud infrastructure business.

images.alt_text: Cerner had about 25,000 employees when the acquisition was announced in December 2021.

site_title: Mbappe tells PSG he will leave when contract ends in 2024
summary: Kylian Mbappe, a 24-year-old French football star, has informed Paris Saint-Germain that he will not renew his contract beyond 2024, potentially opening the door for his transfer during the upcoming summer window. This decision comes a year after he signed an extension to remain at the French champions, and PSG is unlikely to allow him to leave for free. Mbappe's exit could be influenced by talks with the club's hierarchy, following a similar path as Lionel Messi's departure to Inter Miami.

images.alt_text: Chinese fans have been desperate to get close to their hero Messi, with tickets for the game ranging from 580 to 4,800 yuan quickly selling out.
Manchester City defeated Inter Milan 1-0 to win the Champions League on Sunday, completing a rare treble of trophies in one season.
This is the Argentina captain’s seventh visit to China and his first since 2017.
